ygData.subject: New Paper on Improved Evolvable Substrate HyperNEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Sebastian Risi and I are pleased to announce our new GECCO paper (to appear), Enhancing ES-HyperNEAT to Evolve More Complex Regular Neural Networks :

Subject: New Paper on Improved Evolvable Substrate HyperNEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=54567749; y=wlp_oFy83ohA4J-Sqr7Hu5-IS3C9N0OPcIoev-511kqNp0g3OyvA

Sebastian Risi and I are pleased to announce our new GECCO paper (to appear=
), "Enhancing ES-HyperNEAT to Evolve More Complex Regular Neural Networks":=


http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/risi_gecco11.pdf

Abstract: http://eplex.c=
s.ucf.edu/publications/2011/risi.gecco11.html

This paper improves upon the=
 ES-HyperNEAT algorithm (which evolves the placement and density of neurons=
 on the substrate in addition to connectivity) that was introduced last yea=
r to make it significantly faster and easier to apply in practice.  The new=
 enhancement iteratively searches only through cross-sections of the hyperc=
ube instead of through the entire hypercube at once.  Also, while last year=
's work only showed that ES-HyperNEAT can perform as well as regular HyperN=
EAT, this work shows that ES-HyperNEAT has an advantage on some problems, i=
n particular when progressive elaboration of network structure is useful.

=
Figure 8 on page 8 shows a nice example of a progression of networks over e=
volution that illustrates why evolving the substrate is promising.

We are =
planning to release source code for the evolvable substrate before this yea=
r's GECCO.

ken
